# -----------------------------
# MATRIX IN R
# -----------------------------

# 1. Creating a Matrix

# (a) Using matrix() function
m1 <- matrix(1:6, nrow = 2, ncol = 3)            # fills column-wise by default
m2 <- matrix(1:6, nrow = 2, ncol = 3, byrow=TRUE) # fills row-wise

# (b) Using rbind() and cbind()
row1 <- c(1, 2, 3)
row2 <- c(4, 5, 6)
m3 <- rbind(row1, row2)  # bind rows
m4 <- cbind(row1, row2)  # bind columns

# -----------------------------
# 2. Accessing Elements
m <- matrix(1:9, nrow=3, byrow=TRUE)

elem <- m[2, 3]        # element at 2nd row, 3rd column
row2 <- m[2, ]         # entire 2nd row
col3 <- m[, 3]         # entire 3rd column
subm <- m[1:2, 2:3]    # sub-matrix (rows 1-2, cols 2-3)

# -----------------------------
# 3. Matrix Operations
A <- matrix(1:4, nrow=2)
B <- matrix(5:8, nrow=2)

add <- A + B           # element-wise addition
sub <- A - B           # element-wise subtraction
mul <- A * B           # element-wise multiplication
div <- A / B           # element-wise division
prod <- A %*% B        # matrix multiplication (dot product)

# -----------------------------
# 4. Useful Functions on Matrices
m5 <- matrix(1:12, nrow=3, byrow=TRUE)

dim_m5 <- dim(m5)      # dimensions (rows, cols)
nrow_m5 <- nrow(m5)    # number of rows
ncol_m5 <- ncol(m5)    # number of cols

transpose <- t(m5)     # transpose
row_sum <- rowSums(m5) # sum of each row
col_sum <- colSums(m5) # sum of each col
row_mean <- rowMeans(m5) # mean of each row
col_mean <- colMeans(m5) # mean of each col

# -----------------------------
# 5. Naming Rows & Columns
m6 <- matrix(1:9, nrow=3, byrow=TRUE)
rownames(m6) <- c("R1", "R2", "R3")
colnames(m6) <- c("C1", "C2", "C3")

# -----------------------------
# PRINTING RESULTS
print("Matrix m1:"); print(m1)
print("Matrix m2 (by row):"); print(m2)
print("Matrix m3 (rbind):"); print(m3)
print("Matrix m4 (cbind):"); print(m4)

print("Element m[2,3]:"); print(elem)
print("Row 2:"); print(row2)
print("Column 3:"); print(col3)
print("Sub-matrix 1:2,2:3:"); print(subm)

print("Matrix A:"); print(A)
print("Matrix B:"); print(B)
print("A+B:"); print(add)
print("A-B:"); print(sub)
print("A*B:"); print(mul)
print("A/B:"); print(div)
print("A %*% B (matrix multiplication):"); print(prod)

print("Matrix m5:"); print(m5)
print("Dimensions:"); print(dim_m5)
print("Transpose:"); print(transpose)
print("Row sums:"); print(row_sum)
print("Col sums:"); print(col_sum)
print("Row means:"); print(row_mean)
print("Col means:"); print(col_mean)

print("Matrix m6 with names:"); print(m6)

# ---------------- Advanced Control Structures in R ---------------------

# ----- Vectorized ifelse (fast & efficient) -----
nums <- -5:5

                     ifelse(nums < 0, "Negative", "Zero"))

# ----- Nested ifelse for grading system -----

          ifelse(marks >= 75, "B",
          ifelse(marks >= 60, "C",
          ifelse(marks >= 45, "D", "F"))))

# ----- Switch with default case -----

  for (j in 1:ncol(mat)) {
    print(paste("Element at [", i, ",", j, "] =", mat[i,j]))
  }

while (counter <= 5) {
  if (counter %% 2 == 1) {
    print(paste("Odd number:", counter))
  }

}


# ----- Repeat loop with random break -----
set.seed(123)
attempts <- 0
repeat {
  attempts <- attempts + 1
  num <- sample(1:10, 1)
  print(paste("Try", attempts, "=> got", num))
  
  if (num == 7) {
    print("Lucky 7 found, stopping loop!")
    break
  }
}


# ----- Break & Next combined -----
for (x in 1:10) {
  if (x == 3) {
    next  # skip 3
  }
  if (x > 7) {
    break # stop completely after 7
  }
  print(x)
}

median(x)





# 1.3 Dispersion
var(x)
sd(x)

IQR(x) # interquartile range
range(x) # min & max



# 1.5 Quantiles
quantile(x, probs = c(.05, .25, .5, .75, .95))


# 1.6 Outlier detection via IQR rule
Q1 <- quantile(x, .25)
Q3 <- quantile(x, .75)
whisker <- 1.5 * IQR(x)
lo <- Q1 - whisker; hi <- Q3 + whisker
outliers <- x[x < lo | x > hi]
list(Q1 = Q1, Q3 = Q3, Lower = lo, Upper = hi, Outliers = outliers)

# Binomial Distribution
plot_binom <- function(n,p){
  x=0:n
  bin=dbinom(x,n,p)
  mu_x=n*p
  plot(x,bin,type="h",lwd=5, main=paste("density=",n,",p=",p), xlab="x", ylab="p(X=x)")
  abline(v=mu_x,col="red",lwd=4)
}
n=40
values=c(0.05,0.1,0.4,0.5,0.9,0.95)
par(mfrow=c(2,3)) # Correction: Adjusted rows/columns to match number of plots
for (p in values) {
  plot_binom(n,p)
}

# Cumulative Distribution Functions for Binomial
plot_binom_cdf <- function(n,p){
  x=0:n
  bin=pbinom(x,n,p)
  plot(bin,type="s",lwd=2, main=paste("density=",n,",p=",p), xlab="x", ylab="p(X=x)")
  abline(h=0.8,col="red")
}
n=40
values=c(0.05,0.1,0.4,0.5,0.9,0.95) # Correction: Used consistent 'values' variable
par(mfrow=c(2,3)) # Correction: Adjusted to match number of plots
for(p in values){
  plot_binom_cdf(n,p)
}

# Poisson Distribution
plot_pois_pmf <- function(mu){
  x=0:100 # Correction: Defined 'n' as a range since it was hardcoded earlier
  pois=dpois(x,lambda=mu)
  mu_x=mu
  plot(x,pois,type="h",lwd=3, main=paste("Poisson density: mu=",mu), xlab="x", ylab="p(X=x)")
  abline(v=mu_x,col="red",lwd=2)
}
n=100
values=c(0.5,1,5,8,20,50)
par(mfrow=c(3,2))
for (mu in values) {
  plot_pois_pmf(mu)
}

# Cumulative Distribution Functions for Poisson
plot_pois_cdf <- function(mu){
  x=0:100 # Correction: Defined 'n' as a range
  pois=ppois(x,mu)
  plot(x,pois,type="s",lwd=2, main=paste("Poisson distribution mu=",mu), xlab="number of events x", ylab="p(X=x)")
}
n=100
values=c(0.5,1,5,8,20,50)
par(mfrow=c(3,2))
for (mu in values) {
  plot_pois_cdf(mu)
}

# Comparing Poisson with Binomial
par(mfrow=c(2,1))
plot_binom_cdf(10,0.5)
plot_pois_cdf(5)
par(mfrow=c(2,1))
plot_binom_cdf(1000,0.0005)
plot_pois_cdf(5)
